summary: The study used combinatorial consensus mutagenesis to generate stabilized variants of b-lactamase from Enterobacter cloacae, identifying key mutations that significantly increased thermal and proteolytic stability.
key_claims: Identified 15 variants with significantly increased thermostability out of 90 random isolates screened.
The most stable variant had a midpoint of thermal denaturation (Tm) 9.1°C higher than the starting molecule.
Eighteen mutations were identified, with 11 stabilizing and eight destabilizing contributions.

_title: Construction of stabilized proteins by combinatorial consensus mutagenesis
_abstract: We constructed stabilized variants of b-lactamase (BLA) from Enterobacter cloacae by combinatorial recruitment of consensus mutations. By aligning the sequences of 38 BLA homologs, we identified 29 positions where the E.cloacae gene differs from the consensus sequence of lactamases and constructed combinatorial libraries using mixtures of mutagenic oligonucleotides encompassing all 29 positions. Screening of 90 random isolates from these libraries identified 15 variants with significantly increased thermostability. The stability of these isolates suggest that all tested mutations make additive contributions to protein stability. A statistical analysis of sequence and stability data identified 11 mutations that made stabilizing contributions and eight mutations that destabilized the protein.
